eng.title: Hey! Nice to see you...
eng.text: My name is Tiago, I'm {replace_age} years old. I work and study system's development. I've been messing around with the internet since I was a child, so it was very natural for me to know what type of career I wanted to invest on. When I was eleven years old, I had a blog, in which I would venture editing the HTML and CSS. I miss blogger. Time went on and I've been studying and working now over three years with various technologies in many projects. My plan, is to continue learning and working with great teams.

rightPaneInfo.experienceText: Colaborando desde 2018 na everis, tive o prazer de fazer parte de um excelente time de sustentaÃ§Ã£o em uma das gigantes da Telecom mundial. AtuaÃ§Ã£o na Ã¡rea de CRM prestando suporte para sistemas de vendas com correÃ§Ãµes nÃ­vel funcional e tÃ©cnico.

Sendo minha primeira experiÃªncia na Ã¡rea dev, a Sigma me elevou a um novo patamar na minha carreira. Os projetos foram desafiadores e ao final de cada entrega sempre a satisfaÃ§Ã£o de ver a demanda funcionando. AtuaÃ§Ã£o na Ã¡rea de desenvolvimento de funcionalidades em sistemas do governo do paranÃ¡ (CELEPAR) e homologaÃ§Ã£o com o cliente.

In collaboration with everis since 2018, I had the pleasure of being part of an excellent team in the sustainability area on one of the biggest telecom companies in the world. This project introduced me to various new challenges and learnings, a better comprehension of business big picture involving IT and reinforced the importancy of synchrony and team work. Role in CRM, supporting sales systems with fixes in functional and technical level.

Collaborating with Sigma was my first experience as a developer, it elevated me to a new higher place in my career and for that I'm very much grateful. Being involved in their projects proven to be challenging but after every release would come the sensation of joy to see everything working as planned. Role in development of new functionalities for systems as a third-party, final client was ParanÃ¡'s government (CELEPAR) and supporting during validation with client after release.

ptb.title: Projetos
ptb.description: Com o passar dos anos, fui acumulando alguns projetos pessoais e acadÃªmicos os quais foram divertidos de serem desenvolvidos. Nesta seÃ§Ã£o gostaria de mostrar alguns desses pequenos projetos.

rightPanelInfo.title: Sonic Phaser Game
rightPanelInfo.text: O saudoso porco-espinho azul sempre foi um personagem muito presente na minha infÃ¢ncia. Me lembro de passar horas jogando titulos como Sonic the hedgehog, Sonic 3, Sonic 3D e outros da saga. Em 2018 participei de um Workshop interno da empresa onde o foco era JavaScript, entÃ£o resolvi dar uma tentativa e dar vida ao personagem. O jogo acabou ficando em um estÃ¡gio bem inicial, muito tempo foi consumido desenvolvendo os conceitos de fÃ­sica para andar e animaÃ§Ãµes do personagem.

rightPanelInfo.title: Tinman Art - Portfolio
rightPanelInfo.text: Desde muito cedo, meu primo jÃ¡ possuia aptidÃ£o para o desenho, algo que sempre foi muito presente em nossa familia. ApÃ³s muito treinamento e ponderamento, ele optou por seguir na Ã¡rea de Design, visando sempre que pode, aprimorar suas habilidades na ilustraÃ§Ã£o e um dia trabalhar apenas com suas artes e desenhos. Pensando nisso, ele me trouxe a ideia de criar um portfÃ³lio em que ele pudesse mostrar suas artes, de maneira simples e rÃ¡pida, mas nÃ£o menos elegante. Assim, depois de algumas brainstorms de ideias chegamos em um formato similar a este site meu, porÃ©m totalmente voltado para as artes dele. Sinta-se a vontade para conferir nosso trabalho. Se algo estiver meio fora do lugar, pedimos desculpa pois ainda estÃ¡ em um estÃ¡gio inicial ðŸ˜‡

rightPanelInfo.title: Calculadora simples com JS+HTML
rightPanelInfo.text: Como nÃ£o poderia deixar de ser, um dos meus primeiros projetos pessoais foi uma calculadora utilizando JS, Bootstrap e CSS para estilizaÃ§Ã£o dos tamanhos. Ela possui um funcionamento bÃ¡sico, apenas com as funÃ§Ãµes principais, nÃ£o possui nem a funÃ§Ã£o de multiplicaÃ§Ã£o. eng.title: Showcase
eng.description: Over the years I've accumulated some personal and academic projects I had fun going through. In this section I'd like to show you some of those projects.

rightPanelInfo.title: Tinman Art - Portfolio
rightPanelInfo.text: Since his young age, my cousin already had a gift for drawing, something that has been present in my family for decades. After practice and giving some thought into, he decided he should go on the pursuit of his Design degree, but never giving up to enhance his illustration skills, hoping someday work with his arts and drawings. After some water went under the bridge, he came to me with this idea of putting together a portfolio, whose he could display his arts, in a simple and fast yet fancy way. So, after some brainstorms we came up with a similar design of this site, but with the attention completely turned onto his arts. Please, take a look at our work. If something feels a bit out of place, we apologize, it is still in early stages ðŸ˜‡

rightPanelInfo.title: Sonic Phaser Game
rightPanelInfo.text: The nostalgic blue hedgehog were always present in my childhood. I have memories of spending hours and hours playing games of the Sonic franchise. On 2018, I attended to an internal workshop in my company focused on the JavaScript language, so I decided I should give it a try and relive him once again in my personal project. This project was really fun to begin, up until this day it remains in a very early stage, much of the time was used to develop the base concepts to walk, jump and animate the character.

rightPanelInfo.title: Dummy Guess The Color Game(ish?)
rightPanelInfo.text: In this project you get in the shoes of Akinator, that genie that guesses what character you're thinking on. But now you have to guess what the machine is thinking of. Funny how the tables turn huh ? Take your chances and try to guess, but don't try to hard because it's not so well developed and it has somes bugs ðŸ˜‹

rightPanelInfo.title: Dummy JS+HTML Calculator
rightPanelInfo.text: ItÂ couldn'tÂ beÂ differentÂ !Â OneÂ ofÂ myÂ firstÂ personalÂ projectsÂ wasÂ aÂ dummyÂ calculatorÂ usingÂ JS,Â BootstrapÂ andÂ CSSÂ forÂ stylingÂ sizes.Â ItÂ doesÂ theÂ basics,Â itÂ hasÂ onlyÂ theÂ mainÂ operationsÂ ofÂ aÂ simpleÂ calculator,butÂ itÂ doesn'tÂ evenÂ haveÂ theÂ multiplicationÂ functionÂ sadly.Â IÂ plannedÂ onÂ givingÂ itÂ someÂ moreÂ loveÂ andÂ refactoringÂ itÂ (solveÂ someÂ bugsÂ andÂ stuffÂ likeÂ that)Â toÂ displayÂ itÂ here,Â but itÂ kindaÂ wouldÂ loseÂ itsÂ historicÂ purpose.
